title: Can Zelensky Trust Trump? Ukraine’s Fate May Depend on the Answer.
summary: President Trump has offered only vague assurances of security guarantees for Ukraine if President Volodymyr Zelensky agrees to cut a deal with Russia.

title: At White House Summit, a Master Class of Diplomacy. In Courting Trump.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and other European leaders have learned a thing or two about negotiating, Trump-style. So has Vladimir Putin.

title: Zelensky Says He’s Ready to Meet Putin After Trump Talks
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky emerged upbeat, but repeated that Ukraine will not cede land to Russia. There were few tangible signs of progress toward a peace deal.

title: 5 Takeaways From Trump’s Meeting With Zelensky and European Leaders
summary: The leaders presented a relatively united front and appeared to agree on the next steps in the effort to halt the fighting between Ukraine and Russia. But much remained unresolved.

title: Trump Administration Discusses Taking 10% Stake in Intel
summary: Federal officials are considering the move because Intel, the last leading-edge chipmaker in the United States, has been struggling.

title: In Surprise Move, Trump Taps Missouri Attorney General to Help Run F.B.I.
summary: The move appears to diminish the authority of the current deputy director, Dan Bongino, whose tumultuous tenure has included a pitched argument over files related to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Air Force’s Top General to Retire Early
summary: Gen. David Allvin, the chief of staff of the Air Force, is the latest high-ranking general to exit following President Trump’s purge of Pentagon leadership.

title: Mississippi and Louisiana Will Send National Guard Troops to D.C.
summary: Ohio, West Virginia and South Carolina have also deployed the Guard to Washington to support President Trump’s crackdown on the city.

title: Republican Bid to Help Trump Move Past Epstein Falls Flat
summary: Republicans in Congress managed to recess for the summer without voting on the issue, but it has continued to dog them and awaits them when they return.

title: Justice Dept. Will Begin Sharing Epstein Files on Friday, Top Republican Says
summary: The chairman of the House Oversight Committee said the department would miss a Tuesday deadline his panel set in a subpoena but would begin sharing some records on Friday.

title: Why Rip Currents From Hurricane Erin Are So Dangerous to the East Coast
summary: Rip currents are the third leading cause of deaths from hurricanes, and they can happen on a sunny day hundreds of miles from the storm.

title: Hurricane Erin Brings Rip Currents Closing Jersey Shore and Rehoboth Beaches
summary: Several beaches in New Jersey and Delaware were closed on Monday as the powerful storm churned in the Atlantic. Rip currents have been blamed for at least one death.

title: Terence Stamp’s Swinging, Smoldering Style
summary: He helped redefine male beauty, ushering in the era of the cinematic bad boy.

title: Hamas Accepts New Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal, Officials Say
summary: It was unclear whether Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was on board with the terms, which came as Qatar and Egypt were intensifying mediation efforts.

title: Israel Is in Talks to Send Gazans to South Sudan, Officials Say
summary: Israel has broadened its push, so far unsuccessful, to persuade other countries to take in Gazans en masse. Critics say the relocation could violate international law.

title: As Trump’s Policies Take Hold, Springfield, Ohio, Loses Its Haitian Work Force
summary: Springfield faced a crisis after Donald Trump falsely claimed Haitians were eating pets. Now his policies are driving out workers like Wilford Rinvil, who left for Canada.

title: Immigration Enforcement Takes Key Role in Trump’s D.C. Crime Crackdown
summary: Immigrants who live and work in the city say they want violent crime lowered but fear that ICE efforts could make it worse.

title: He Sold His Likeness. Now His Avatar Is Shilling Supplements on TikTok.
summary: Welcome to a new era of commercial work fueled by generative artificial intelligence.

title: Madison Avenue Is Starting to Love A.I.
summary: Advertisers are increasingly using generative artificial intelligence to make their commercials.

title: Dealer Known as ‘Ketamine Queen’ to Plead Guilty in Matthew Perry Case
summary: Jasveen Sangha will plead guilty to selling the ketamine that killed the “Friends” star, prosecutors said. She could face decades in prison.

title: Talks Restart as Air Canada Flight Attendants’ Strike Continues
summary: Negotiations between the airline and the flight attendants’ union resumed on Monday, hours after a labor relations board declared the walkout illegal.

title: Air Canada Strike Leaves Stranded Passengers Frustrated and Angry
summary: Many passengers are still struggling to find alternative transportation and are angry at the airline. “You feel like you’re at their mercy,” said one.

title: The Man Who Saw the Future of Africa
summary: As the world’s powers turn away from the continent, Kwame Nkrumah’s vision for Africa may hold the key to realizing its potential today.

title: Trump Just Reminded Me of Why I’m Still a Neocon
summary: By putting the interests of what Trump calls “peace” ahead of the interests of freedom, we are all-but guaranteeing that Ukraine will lose both.

title: Cases of Mosquito-Borne Chikungunya Virus Are Surging Globally: What to Know
summary: Chikungunya, which can disable victims for years, is spreading rapidly, including in China and other places that have not seen it before.

title: A Pakistani Village Devastated by Flooding: ‘Like Death Visited Every Home’
summary: At least 660 people have died in rain-related incidents across Pakistan since monsoon season began in late June, and 935 more have been injured.

title: M.T.A. Approves Major Contract to Expand the Second Avenue Subway Line
summary: The contract, which will award nearly $2 billion to construction firms, funds crucial aspects of the latest phase of the long-awaited subway expansion into East Harlem.

title: Fire and Explosion Damage Ship in Baltimore Harbor
summary: No one was injured in the explosion, which occurred aboard a bulk carrier ship near the site of the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in 2024.
